paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper reports a TTR gene variant G47V associated with hereditary cardiac amyloidosis, detailing its clinical significance, penetrance data, and functional studies.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Heart failure, hypertrophy cardiomyopathy, and history of cardiac hypertrophy and heart block.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 52-year-old male was referred to our hospital, complaining of exertional dyspnea and lower limb edema.

functional_data.summary: G47V-TTR exhibits significantly lower thermodynamic and kinetic stability compared to WT-TTR.
assays: thermodynamic stability measured by urea denaturation curve using tryptophan intrinsic fluorescence
kinetic stability measured by tryptophan fluorescence in urea

variants.segregation_data: The variant was not detected in the patient’s first-degree relatives.
variants.population_frequency: Absent in known human genome databases including 1000 Genomes, GenomeAD, and ExAC.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on biochemical characterization and clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: The G47V variant was characterized for its biochemical properties for the first time in this study.
key_quotes: This missense variant was not detected in the patient’s first-degree relatives.
Thus, TTR c.200G>T was regarded as a possible causal variant in our ATTR-CA patient.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR variant G47V was successfully extracted.
